title.narrative: Strengthening Equality of Farmer Network Project (SEC-NET)

description.narrative: The organisation has recruited 58 (37 F & 21 M) new members and one local network (Longido ward ) is in the process of being formalized as new group . The organisation organised for a Tree planting campaign in Monduli , one of the driest district in the region where 124 members Participated. Over 46849 trees were planted. The organisation has facilitated formation of 11 VICOBA (VSLA) groups who have already been trained on the methodology. So far the groups have mobilized savings of Tshs. 12,056,500 and given out loans amounting to Tshs. 4,325,000. The organisation facilitated some of its members to participate in an Agribusiness Expo as a result twelve (12) beekeeping groups were linked with a reliable market during the event. The groups are now selling 1 kg of honey at Tshs 10,000 after value addition compared to initial farmgate price of Tshs 6000 per kg. The organisation has been supporting farmers to adopt appropriate SALM practices and more so green technologies as a way to mitigate against climate change effects and to support their farming activities . As a result 16 farmers are now using biogas in their households as fuel, 3 households are using wind energy for lighting, 4 farmers using solar powered poultry incubators and 11 farmers using solar powered irrigation pumps.

The overall project goal is Farmers organisation’s capacity built and enhanced livelihood of family farmers in Arusha Region by 2022.Project aims at improving incomes of family farmers through enhanced capacity to advocate for their issues and ensure inclusion of women & youth participation in agricultural value chains by 2022.The expected results are; strengthened organisational capacity to offer effective services to small scale farmers with special focus on women and young members; Strengthened primary networks organisational and members capacity in engaging to gender responsive interventions; Strengthened capacity to engage with duty bearers for gender inclusive frameworks, legislation, policies concerning members welfare; Improved capacity of members with special emphasis on women and young members to engaging in quality, & quantity production of agricultural produce and agribusiness practices; Improved capacity of members to adapt with climate change and enhance environmental sustainability; Improved members’ working capital for agri-business and agriculture production; Reduced production and agri-business risk for women, young people and men; Increased participation of women and young people in leadership and decision making structures / processes; and reduced women and young people socio-cultural injustices.

participating-org.narrative: Mtandao wa Vikundi vya Wakulima wa Tanzania-Arusha

activity-date.narrative: Planned end date of the activity
Planned start date of the activity
